data.title: Gothic/Giallo/Genre: Hybrid Images in Italian HORROR CINEMA, 1956-82
data.meta_description: 206620836.pdf - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides an analysis of three influential Italian horror films from different eras - I Vampiri (1956) directed by Riccardo Freda, The Girl Who Knew Too Much (1963) directed by Mario Bava, and Deep Red (1975) directed by Dario Argento. While Italian horror cinema is often divided into distinct Gothic and Giallo periods, the author argues these three films demonstrate hybrid elements that complicate strict categorization. Through examining these films, the author aims to show how they share underlying elements of creating "fearing fictions" as described by film theorist Noel Carroll, but cannot be definitively classified as solely Gothic or Giallo due to incorporating aspects of both
